_header: Ye that will let good men blood
_description: Variant version of instructions for bloodletting — in couplets

CamTCC921.Transcription:
For to kenne þe veynes to late blodeTo þe þat lates
                    many gode men blodeAnd wynnes þer with þi worldes fodeTake
                    hede þat þou doo but godeSomme veynes vse þey
                    sykerle………
CamTCC921.Attributed Title: Modus qui docet ad minuendum sanguinem (f. 33)

BLEge2572.First Lines:
Ȝe that wyll lette gude men blodeAnd vaynes wyth all
                    ȝowre liues fodeSome vaynes vse ȝeAnd mony other lette
                    ȝe beTherefore nowe wyll I them scheweAnd tell ȝowe them
                    apone a raweAnd where they lye euer ylke oneAnd for what thynge they
                    shall be tone…
BLEge2572.Last Lines:
…And wemen that hath tynt ther floureslete them blede in there
                    bowres…
BLEge2572.Attributed Title: To knawe the vaynes to let blode one (f. 69)
BLEge2572.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,  and  Percy Furnivall, eds.  
             Vicary’s Anatomie of the Bodie of Man.
EETS
         e.s. 53 (1888; repr. 1973): 228-9.
